{"handle": "devhub-platform", "community": {"tag": "devhub-platform", "name": "DevHub Platform", "addons": [{"id": "p56v0f", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# \\\\u{1f44b} Welcome!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis community is all about delivering high impact features to the [NEAR DevHub Platform](http://neardevhub.org), a decentralized community platform for NEAR developers to contribute to the ecosystem and stay informed. This space aims to serve as an entry point to individuals, experts, and organizations who are interested in contributing. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Our Groups\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe have two main groups:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 1. Working group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a group of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to the DevHub Platform. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO, and hold grant takers accountable. They also engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- @frol.near\\\\\\\\n- @ori.near\\\\\\\\n- @bo.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 2. Community contributors\\\\\\\\nWe have a core group of regular product & technical community contributors who regularly work on making the DevHub platform better, from contributing code to reporting and triaging issues. These individuals collaborate across different time zones using lightweight and mostly asynchronous processes. To learn more about how we work, check out our project [README](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets#how-to-contribute) page on GitHub.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## What are we working on?\\\\\\\\nTo track our progress and manage issues effectively, we use a [Kanban board](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60/views/1). You can also check out our [current](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets/milestones) and [past](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets/milestones?state=closed) initiatives.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Communication channels\\\\\\\\nWe use the following channels for communication:\\\\\\\\n- [GitHub:](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60/views/1) For specific issues and pull requests. Enable notifications to ensure you get the latest updates.\\\\\\\\n- [Telegram:](https://t.me/devhubplatform) For general questions or concerns.\\\\\\\\n- [Weekly Standup Calls](https://bit.ly/DevHubCalendar): To align on priorities and discuss progress, plans, and blockers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How to get involved\\\\\\\\nAnyone is welcome to contribute to the DevHub platform. Here are ways to get involved:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Contribute code**: Review the list of [good first issues](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/contribute). You can pick any issues from the [Backlog column](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60) and indicate your interest by leaving comments. Before you get started, we encourage you to check out [how we work](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/blob/main/docs/how-we-work.md) and the [developer guidelines](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).\\\\\\\\n* **Report issues**: To report a [bug](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues/new?assignees=&labels=bug&template=bug_report.md&title=) or a [feature request](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues/new?assignees=&labels=enhancement&template=feature-request.md&title=), please review all open and closed [issues](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aall+) to make sure no one has previously created a similar topic. If you have a more robust proposal or idea that you\\\\\\'d like to discuss, you are also welcome to create an idea or solution post on our community here.\\\\\\\\n* **Triage issues**: You are welcome to help us triage by verifying or reproducing bugs, adding more specific reproduction instructions, or voting on issues by adding a \\\\u{1f44d} thumbs-up reaction to the issue\\\\\\'s description comment.  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to become a paid contributor\\\\\\\\nAs an an open-source project, we greatly approach the contributions of each individual. We aim to grow an ecosystem of developers who are here because they like the technology and community. Given that there\\\\u{2019}s a lot of time and effort that goes into this, we have financial means to compensate for some activities and projects for regular contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you are interested in getting compensate for contributing your skills and expertise to our project, the best way to get started is to first familiarize yourself with [DevHub](https://www.neardevhub.org) and start getting involved (see section above). Once you\\\\u{2019}ve gained the community\\\\u{2019}s trust by demonstrating high-quality contributions and ongoing commitment, you can [apply here](https://near.social/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=507). \\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About us \\\\u{2b50}\\\\u{fe0f}"}, {"id": "870s2b", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"A Developer\\\\\\'s Guide to Active Participation in the DevHub\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**The DevHub Platform is your homebase for connecting with other developers and mentors, sharing ideas, proposing events, accessing resources, and finding communities working on diverse projects \\\\u{2013} from protocol development to tooling and documentation**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Ways to Participate \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Join a Community:** Explore communities [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities).\\\\\\\\n- **Improve NEAR Documentation:** Contribute on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/docs).\\\\\\\\n- **Seek Mentorship:** Check out Office hours hosted on Discord and connect with all DevRels via our DevRel Telegram.\\\\\\\\n- **Host an Event/Hackathon:** Wunna host an event / hackathon? Power it up with [Hackbox](https://near.social/hackbox.near/widget/home).\\\\\\\\n- **Join NEAR Campus:** To support your blockchain club / university...Be part of [NEAR Campus](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=near-campus).\\\\\\\\n- **Post a Proposal:** Got an idea you\\\\\\'ll like to bring to the Ecosystem? Use this [Guide](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=203)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to Stay Updated:\\\\\\\\nSubscribe to our [newsletter](https://newsletter.neardevhub.org/) and join the Telegram group for the latest updates.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Get Involved:\\\\\\\\nRegardless of your background or wherever you are in the world, we invite you to explore, find your community, and discover paths to contribute that are most gratifying for you. Let\\\\\\'s build the open web together!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "How to use DevHub \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}"}, {"id": "5jy6ev", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blog", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "DevHub Blog"}], "admins": ["theori.near", "victorkanu1.near", "frol.near"], "handle": "devhub-platform", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreickgqvypgp5vty4udeuslxxaxm3n6lemwjfkebyddzzl4jif3qddi", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreievtx75idx2aw3ipy7q2etvvzxh2kn6e3evzqsgm3cjyh6otehtjy", "description": "Delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform.", "website_url": "neardevhub.org", "bio_markdown": "A community of product & technical contributors focusing on delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform that empower NEAR developers to thrive and contribute.", "github_handle": "near-devhub", "twitter_handle": "NEARDevHub", "telegram_handle": "neardevhub"}}

{"handle": "zero-knowledge", "community_addon": {"id": "lv25d8", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Zero Knowledge (ZK) proof is a method for verifying a transaction without disclosing the details of the transaction. This technology has various use cases within blockchain, such as enhancing scalability and privacy.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis community brings together individuals, experts, and organizations who are interested in developing a ZK ecosystem on NEAR. Our vision is to drive the development of ZK technology and explore its potential applications.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Structure \\\\\\\\nThe Zero Knowledge community consists of two groups: the community group and the work group working group. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space for anyone interested in Zero Knowledge and its applications. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to meet with others to share ideas and submit proposals. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. The group has a dedicated Telegram channel as well as regular monthly calls.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working Group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to Zero Knowledge on NEAR. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO, and hold grant takers accountable. They also engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- Anton Yezhov (@yezhov.near)\\\\\\\\n- Garvit Goel (@garvit_electron.near)\\\\\\\\n- Igor Gulamov (@igorgulamov.near)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Communication Channels \\\\\\\\nThe ZK community communicates through the [ZK Telegram group](https://t.me/NearZeroKnowledge).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe community also community calls that take place every two months, the recordings can be found [here](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLrLLmjcJVAB9H6Jhm33S7nhwSadQplbGD). These calls give the community a chance to discuss current topics, discuss proposals and share what they have been working on. If you have a topic suggestion please reach out on Telegram.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOur next community call is taking place in  **April**.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How to get involved \\\\\\\\nThe best way to get involved is to join the discussion happening on our Telegram and our community calls. If you would like to contribute to an ZK project within the ecosystem check out the [Projects](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=zero-knowledge&tab=Projects) tab  If you have an idea or solution for enhancing ZK on NEAR please see the [Proposals](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=zero-knowledge&tab=Proposals) tab.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Resources\\\\\\\\nTo be completed.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have an idea to improve this page or spot an error please fill in this [Google form](https://forms.gle/whyTeNXBWUYJAnpn7).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"center\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About"}}

{"body": {"name": "Owen Developer Relations Contributor Report ", "summary": "Bi-weekly paid developer relations report. The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "## Timeline\\\\nStart Date: February 19, 2024\\\\n\\\\nEnd Date: March 3, 2024\\\\n\\\\u{200b}\\\\n## Requested Funding\\\\nHours: 91:40\\\\n\\\\nRate: $50/hour \\\\n\\\\nTotal Amount: $4,583\\\\n\\\\n# Summary of Activities\\\\n### Direct Developer Support\\\\n- 0:50 Supporting developers with questions they have through Discord and Telegram.\\\\n\\\\n### Technical Communities\\\\n- 0:30 ZK Community Call prep.\\\\n- 1:00 ZK Community Call.\\\\n- 1:00 Editing and uploading ZK Call to Youtube, recording can be found [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nNMeudZL2Pc&t=1s).\\\\n- 1:00 Other ZK Community activities.\\\\n\\\\n### Events\\\\n- 0:30 ETH Denver prep call.\\\\n- 1:30 Call and planning with Ludium for ETH Seoul.\\\\n- 0:30 Interaction with Hackbox events and initiatives.\\\\n- 80:00 ETH Denver support (22/3 - 1/4) mainly assisting hackers, also includes travel, delivered online dev-support and completed more post ZK Call activities when the event was quiet. Winners can be seen [here](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1768747575073792027?s=19).\\\\n- 2:00 ETH Denver remote judging\\\\n\\\\n### NEAR Campus\\\\n- 0:40 Interaction with NEAR Campus events and initiatives.\\\\n \\\\n### General / Other\\\\n- 0:10 Opening DevHub issue.\\\\n- 0:20 Team call.\\\\n- 0:10 Reviewing proposals.\\\\n- 1:30 Misc activities, includes assisting DevRel team, interaction with verticals like Hackbox, channel moderation etc.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "pivortex.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "4583", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n__Read the full proposal [here](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=6)__\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

Winners can be seen [here](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1768747575073792027?s=19).\\\\n- 2:00 ETH Denver remote judging\\\\n\\\\n### NEAR Campus\\\\n- 0:40 Interaction with NEAR Campus events and initiatives.\\\\n \\\\n### General / Other\\\\n- 0:10 Opening DevHub issue.\\\\n- 0:20 Team call.\\\\n- 0:10 Reviewing proposals.\\\\n- 1:30 Misc activities, includes assisting DevRel team, interaction with verticals like Hackbox, channel moderation etc.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "pivortex.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "4583", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "pivortex.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Owen Developer Relations Contributor Report ", "summary": "Bi-weekly paid developer relations report. The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "bpolania.near", "description": "## Timeline\\\\nStart Date: March 4, 2024\\\\n\\\\nEnd Date: March 17, 2024\\\\n\\\\u{200b}\\\\n## Requested Funding\\\\nHours: 24:05\\\\n\\\\nRate: $50/hour \\\\n\\\\nTotal Amount: $1,204\\\\n\\\\n# Summary of Activities\\\\n\\\\n### Direct Developer Support\\\\n- 4:50 Supporting developers with questions through Discord and Telegram.\\\\n\\\\n### Technical Communities\\\\n- 4:40 Completing Community Call Guide to help other devrels and community moderators to run their own call.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### NEAR Campus and Events\\\\n- 5:20 Remote support for ETH Oxford, this included helping set up bounties, adapting developer workshop for talk, providing support to the in-person devrel team and answering questions remotely.\\\\n- 0:45 Finding and prepping an additional DevRel for ETH Oxford (Clemens supported us here).\\\\n- 1:00 Remote NFT Soho support and feedback on schedule.\\\\n- 0:20 Filtering ETH Denver hackathon submissions and adding them to a spreadsheet to be submitted to the Electric Capital report \\\\n \\\\n### General / Other\\\\n- 2:20 DevRel team calls.\\\\n- 3:30 Reviewing DevHub proposals.\\\\n- 0:40 Developer Newsletter feedback, most recent edition can be found [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=3193).\\\\n- 0:40 Misc activities, includes assisting DevRel team, interaction with verticals like Hackbox, channel moderation etc.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "icespice.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1204", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}
